RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the group: Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero, Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez, Jaime Gomez-Arroyo, and seven other undocumented aliens
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the group members: Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero, Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez, Jaime Gomez-Arroyo, and seven other undocumented aliens
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.members of the group: Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero, Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez, Jaime Gomez-Arroyo, and seven other undocumented aliens

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero: Defendant who pled guilty to transporting undocumented aliens for financial gain and acted as a guide into the United States, guiding a group of nine aliens including Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez, argued against sentence enhancement under reckless endangerment, and was involved in a case where his conduct was found to constitute 'reckless conduct' for purposes of the enhancement. Garcia also provided inaccurate advice on journey length, which led to insufficient water and food supplies for the aliens.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.KING: Chief Judge presiding over the case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez: undocumented female alien who died from probable heat stroke during the journey, caused by trudging through the hot South Texas desert in June, described as a 142-pound, normally developed and adequately nourished adult female in the autopsy report
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jaime Gomez-Arroyo: uncle of Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez who met with border patrol agents and remained behind with her when she became ill
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero, Alma Delia Si: group of nine aliens being guided by Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero for financial gain
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Cuyler: referenced in a case regarding reckless conduct in the transportation of illegal aliens, where the offense conduct at issue was transporting unrestrained aliens in the bed of a pickup truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Rodriguez: defendants in a case involving guiding illegal aliens into the United States via the mountains between Mexico and San Diego
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero and others: defendants involved in cases related to the transportation of undocumented aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Herrera: court in the Ninth Circuit that addressed whether intent is required for an enhancement under a specific subsection and made a statement regarding causal connection between offense conduct and death or injury in a footnote
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Defendants in Rodriguez case: guides employed by alien smugglers to transport illegal aliens into the United States via the mountains between Mexico and San Diego for financial gain
